trans-unit.source: Represents a binding to a window handle that supports visual composition.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndTarget"></xref> class, using the specified HWND.
The handle for the window that this object draws to.
Gets or sets the background color of the window referenced by this <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndTarget"></xref>.
The background is drawn before any other visual component.
The color used must have an alpha component of 1.0.
If you attempt to specify a different alpha value in the provided <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color>, it automatically resets to 1.0.
The background color, as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> value.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndTarget"></xref>.
Gets or sets the rendering mode for the window referenced by this <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndTarget"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.RenderMode"></xref> values that specifies the current render mode.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.RenderMode"></xref>.
Gets or sets the root visual object of the page that is hosted by the window.
The root visual object of the hosted page.
Gets a matrix that transforms the coordinates of the device that is associated with the rendering destination of this target.
The transform matrix.
Gets a matrix that transforms the coordinates of this target to the device that is associated with the rendering destination.
The transform matrix.
Gets a value that declares whether the per-pixel opacity value of the source window content is used for rendering.
If you enable per-pixel opacity, the rendering subsystem no longer draws the non-client area (edge of window).
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if using per-pixel opacity; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
